questions.question: What is the definition of angular momentum?

answers.a: The tendency of a rotating body to resist changes in its state of motion
answers.b: The product of linear velocity and mass
answers.c: The product of rotational inertia and angular velocity
answers.d: The rate of change of angular velocity

questions.question: According to the conservation of angular momentum, what happens if there is no net external torque acting on a system?

answers.a: The angular momentum of the system decreases
answers.b: The angular momentum of the system increases
answers.c: The angular momentum of the system remains constant
answers.d: The angular momentum of the system becomes zero

questions.question: How is the total angular momentum of a system calculated?

answers.a: By summing the linear momenta of all the particles in the system
answers.b: By summing the masses of all the particles in the system
answers.c: By summing the products of mass and velocity of all the particles in the system
answers.d: By summing the individual angular momenta of all the particles in the system
